law.catch_line: Sign to indicate fresh meat or fresh meat product produced outside United States -- Exemptions.

text.section: Any person who sells or exposes for sale any fresh meat or fresh meat product which is produced outside of the United States shall indicate by a sign displayed over each kind of meat or meat product that the meat or meat product is "foreign meat" or "imported meat" using lettering at least two (2) inches in height and displayed either in or on the meat counter.
"Meat" means pork, beef, poultry, mutton, and lamb.

This section and KRS 367.857 shall not apply to fresh meat or fresh meat product:
Not prepared for human consumption;
Prepared by food service establishments as defined in KRS Chapter 219; or
Where the meat or meat product is only a portion of the total consumer item.

law.history: Created 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 142, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1988.
